title: Kate Voegele

text:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter and actress (born 1986)}}
{{Use mdy dates|date=October 2015}}
{{Infobox musical artist
| name            = Kate Voegele
| image           = Kate Voegele 6-26-11 Seattle.jpg
| caption         = Voegele performing at the Showbox at the Market on June 26, 2011 in Seattle, Washington
| birth_name      = Kate Elizabeth Voegele
| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|1986|12|8}}
| birth_place     = [[Bay Village, Ohio]], United States
| instrument      = Vocals, guitar, [[mandolin]], piano
| genre           = {{hlist|[[Pop music|Pop]]|[[pop rock]]|[[folk-pop]]}}

}}

'''Kate Elizabeth Voegele''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|v|oʊ|.|g|əl|}}; born December 8, 1986) is an American singer-songwriter and actress. She made her musical debut in 2003, with the release of her ''The Other Side'' extended play. She performed numerous local live shows to promote the album, and toured with artists such as [[John Mayer]]. In 2005, she released her second extended play, ''Louder Than Words''. Both had local success, and helped raise awareness of Voegele as an artist. During this time period, Voegele performed at events such as [[Farm Aid]] to promote her music, and began posting her music on popular social media network MySpace. She also won numerous awards and honors for her songwriting abilities.

Voegele officially signed with Interscope Records in 2006, and immediately began working on her official debut album. Her first studio album, ''[[Don't Look Away (Kate Voegele album)|Don't Look Away]]'', was released in 2007 to generally positive reviews. The album became her first to chart on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], and was re-released numerous times since its release. It spawned two singles, one of which charted on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and the [[UK Singles Chart]]. While promoting this album, Voegele began appearing as [[Mia Catalano]] in the television series ''[[One Tree Hill (TV series)|One Tree Hill]]''. This made her acting debut, and helped promote her music. She would remain a recurring cast member for four seasons, lasting until 2011.

Voegele released her second studio album, ''[[A Fine Mess (album)|A Fine Mess]]'' in 2009. The album debuted at number 10 on the ''Billboard'' 200. It spawned one single, "[[99 Times]]", which became her most successful radio single in the US to date. Numerous promotional singles were released to promote the album, some of which had commercial success. In 2011, Voegele released her third studio album, ''[[Gravity Happens]]''. This was her first album to be released through [[ATO Records]]. The album debuted and peaked at number 53 on the ''Billboard'' 200. Her fourth studio album, ''[[Canyonlands (album)|Canyonlands]]'', was released in 2016.

==Early life==
Kate Elizabeth Voegele was born in the [[Cleveland]] suburb of [[Bay Village, Ohio]]{{Citation needed |date=March 2022}} on December 8, 1986. Voegele has a younger sister named Courtney.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.playbill.com/multimedia/gallery/1373/Heights-Bound-Jordin-Sparks-Plays-Nokia-Theatre?pnum=4|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130411162640/http://www.playbill.com/multimedia/gallery/1373/Heights-Bound-Jordin-Sparks-Plays-Nokia-Theatre?pnum=4|url-status=dead|archive-date=April 11, 2013|title=Heights-Bound Jordin Sparks Plays Nokia Theatre|work=Playbill|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> She is of [[Germans|German]], English, French, Irish, Scottish, and Italian descent.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://long-island.newsday.com/kids/kidsday-interviews-singer-kate-voegele-1.883967 |title=Kidsday interviews singer Kate Voegele |publisher=Long-island.newsday.com |date=October 29, 2008 |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> Voegele was taught to play guitar at age 15.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kate Voegele Runs Up A New Hill: The 2014 Popdose Interview|url=http://popdose.com/kate-voegele-runs-up-a-new-hill-the-2014-popdose-interview/|website=Popdose|access-date=August 5, 2015|date=November 3, 2014}}</ref> In 2005, Voegele graduated from [[Bay High School (Bay Village, Ohio)|Bay High School]] where she was on the dance squad.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tv.com/people/kate-voegele/biography/ |title=Kate Voegele Biography |publisher=TV.com |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Widran|first1=Jonathan|title=Singer/Songwriter Kate Voegele Talks About Her Don't Look Away Album, And Her Acting Career|url=http://www.songwriteruniverse.com/katevoegele123.htm|website=Songwriter Universe|access-date=August 5, 2015|date=February 12, 2008}}</ref> She attended college at [[Miami University (Ohio)|Miami University]] where she was a member of [[Kappa Alpha Theta]] sorority.

==Career==

===1999–2006: Musical beginnings and early success===
[[File:KateVoegeleFarmAid2005Chicago640x426byWV.JPG|thumb|220px|Voegele performing at [[Farm Aid]] in Chicago, Illinois, on September 18, 2005]]
Voegele made her musical debut in 2002, while Voegele was only 16 years old, when she recorded and released her debut extended play, ''The Other Side''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cduniverse.com/productinfo.asp?pid=7180007 |title=Kate Voegele – Other Side CD Album |publisher=Cduniverse.com |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> The song "Top of the World" received local radio airplay, and songs from the album were performed locally by Voegele at numerous venues.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chorusandverse.com/content.php?id=20040307B |title=Kate Voegele | Enjoying Success on the Other Side | Interview |publisher=Chorusandverse.com |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> That same year, Voegele performed alongside [[John Mayer]] and [[Counting Crows]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://eventful.com/performers/kate-voegele-/P0-001-000044007-6 |title=Kate Voegele Concert Tour Dates and Tickets |publisher=Eventful |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> In 2004, it was revealed that Voegele would be a performer at the 2004 [[Farm Aid]] concert,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sing365.com/music/lyric.nsf/Kate-Voegele-Biography/5733DA8BCDC759AA48257350000B6C0D |title=Kate Voegele Biography |publisher=Sing365.com |access-date=April 22, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140817042033/http://sing365.com/music/lyric.nsf/Kate-Voegele-Biography/5733DA8BCDC759AA48257350000B6C0D |archive-date=August 17, 2014 |url-status=dead |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://top40-charts.com/news.php?nid=9275 |title=Kate Voegele selected to perform at Farm Aid @ Top40-Charts.com – Songs & Videos from 49 Top 20 & Top 40 Music Charts from 30 Countries |publisher=Top40-charts.com |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> alongside artists such as [[Willie Nelson]] and [[Neil Young]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newfarm.rodaleinstitute.org/news/2004/0904/0920/farm_aid.shtml |title=Willie Nelson headlines Farm Aid to benefit family farms |publisher=Newfarm.rodaleinstitute.org |date=September 20, 2004 |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> Voegele's songs began being used in popular media as well around this time. Her song "Only Fooling Myself" was featured in series' such as ''[[Clubhouse (TV series)|Clubhouse]]'' and ''[[The Ghost Whisperer]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.songfacts.com/detail.php?id=10706 |title=Only Fooling Myself by Kate Voegele Songfacts |publisher=Songfacts.com |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> Her song "It's Only Life" was featured in the [[MTV]] series ''[[Newport Harbor: The Real Orange County]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.songfacts.com/detail.php?id=10704 |title=It's Only Life by Kate Voegele Songfacts |publisher=Songfacts.com |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref>

In 2004, Voegele released her second extended play, ''Louder Than Words''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://imx.mtv.com/music/artist/voegele__kate/albums.jhtml?albumId=924281 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130411103850/http://imx.mtv.com/music/artist/voegele__kate/albums.jhtml?albumId=924281 |url-status=dead |archive-date=April 11, 2013 |title=Louder Than Words by Kate Voegele | MTV |publisher=Imx.mtv.com |date=January 1, 2005 |access-date=April 22, 2013 }}</ref> The extended play, as well as her previous one, helped further draw interest in Voegele as an artist.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.songwriteruniverse.com/katevoegele123.htm |title=Kate Voegele Don't Look Away – Kate Voegele 2008 Interview |date=February 12, 2008 |publisher=Songwriteruniverse.com |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> The album featured songs from her first album, as well as a new song titled "Better Days". That same year, Voegele's song "Only Fooling Myself" won the Pop category of the 2005 USA Songwriting Contest,<ref>{{cite web|last=Laskow |first=Rachel |url=http://www.taxi.com/transmitter/0602/taxi-member-wins-songwriting-competition.html |title=TAXI Member Wins USA Songwriting Competition |publisher=Taxi.com |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> the youngest artist ever to win the honor in any category.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.purevolume.com/katevoegele |title=Kate Voegele on PureVolume |publisher=Purevolume.com |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.miami.muohio.edu/news/article/view/3481 |title=Miami University News: News Release |publisher=Miami.muohio.edu |date=January 24, 2006 |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> In 2006, her song "I Won't Disagree" was a winner of the New York City Songwriters Circle.<ref name="New York City, Songwriters Circle">{{cite web|title=Congratulations to Kate Voegele for winning the 2006 Songwriting Contest for her song I Won't Disagree|url=http://songwriters-circle.com/contest_info.htm|quote="Kate Voegele – I Won't Disagree ***FIRST PLACE GRAND PRIZE WINNER***"|publisher=Songwriters-circle.com|access-date=January 16, 2015|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928065335/http://songwriters-circle.com/contest_info.htm|archive-date=September 28, 2007|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Her song "Only Fooling Myself" also won praise at the 2006 USA Songwriting Competition at Borders Books & Music in Austin, Texas.<ref name="USA Songwriting Competition presented a SXSW Showcase at Borders Books & Music">{{cite web|title=Kate Voegele – 2005 USA Songwriting Competition 1st Prize Winner – Pop|work=USA Songwriting Competition presented a SXSW Showcase at Borders Books & Music|url=http://www.songwriting.net/showcases.html|quote=Kate Voegele (2005 USA Songwriting Competition 1st Prize Winner – Pop)|publisher=Songwriting.net|access-date=January 16, 2015|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090225205449/http://songwriting.net/showcases.html|archive-date=February 25, 2009|df=mdy-all}}</ref>

In 2006, Voegele received a message on popular social media website MySpace from the owner, [[Tom Anderson]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.portraitmagazine.net/archives/katevoegele.html |title=Kate Voegele: Don't look away from Kate – Portrait Magazine, September 2008 Issue |publisher=Portraitmagazine.net |access-date=April 22, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130413201531/http://www.portraitmagazine.net/archives/katevoegele.html |archive-date=April 13, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Anderson asked if Voegele was signed, and later asked her to meet him.<ref name=Seventeen>{{cite web |url=http://www.seventeen.com/cosmogirl/myspace-records-kate-voegele |title=MySpace Records' Kate Voegele sings in the CG! offices |publisher=Seventeen.com |date=December 1, 2007 |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref> She later signed with [[MySpace Records]], a branch of [[Interscope Records]].<ref name=Seventeen /> On the event, Voegele stated "I thought it was a fake message. I mean does Tom really even exist, let alone go on MySpace and send messages to random people? But sure enough, it was totally legitimate, and the next week I was out in LA meeting and showcasing for him. [...] I was so excited because from the start I knew [[MySpace Records]] was different than other labels I'd been to. I felt immediately comfortable and I could tell I would be given a lot of artistic freedom there."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kidzworld.com/article/8555-kate-voegele-interview |title=Kate Voegele Interview | Don't Look Away | MySpace Records | Album | CD | Quote | Picture – Page 1 |publisher=Kidzworld.com |date=May 3, 2011 |access-date=April 22, 2013}}</ref>

===2007–2008: ''Don't Look Away'' and ''One Tree Hill''===
[[File:Kate4.JPG|left|thumb|150px|Voegele performing on the "Back 2 School Tour"]]
Voegele began working on her debut album in Fall of 2006, shortly after signing with the label. She released her official debut studio album, ''[[Don't Look Away (Kate Voegele album)|Don't Look Away]]'', on May 22, 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.the-trades.com/article.php?id=5582|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130411222551/http://www.the-trades.com/article.php?id=5582|url-status=dead|archive-date=April 11, 2013|title=The-trades|publisher=The-trades.com|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.ca/Dont-Look-Away-Kate-Voegele/dp/B000P7V5WA|title=Don't Look Away|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> ''Don't Look Away'' debuted at number 63 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], selling 10,000 copies in its first week of release. It went on to sell over 250,000 copies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tv.com/news/juno-tops-keys-to-hit-no-1-10775/|title=Juno tops Keys to hit No. 1|publisher=CBS Interactive|work=TV.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/1313552/juno-kudos-lead-to-no-1|title='Juno' Kudos Lead to No. 1|magazine=Billboard|date=January 30, 2008|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kidzworld.com/article/8430-aly-and-aj-and-kate-voegele-cd-reviews-music-source|title=Aly & AJ – Kate Voegele – Insomniac – Don't Look Away – Review – Album – CD – MySpace|work=Kidzworld|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2008/01/kate_voegele_takes_her_act_to.html|title=Kate Voegele takes her act to "One Tree Hill"|publisher=Cleveland.com|access-date=January 15, 2015|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924015236/http://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2008/01/kate_voegele_takes_her_act_to.html|archive-date=September 24, 2015|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2008/04/30/exclusive-kate-voegele-calls-kevin-federline-a-down-to-earth-guy/|title=Exclusive: Kate Voegele Calls Kevin Federline A 'Down-To-Earth Guy'|work=Buzzworthy|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> Her appearance on the series was noted as being a big advancement for Voegele career wise,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/id/23488842/site/todayshow/ns/today-entertainment/t/one-tree-hill-helps-launch-kate-voegele/#.UTU7H1eCm1c|title='One Tree Hill' helps launch Kate Voegele|work=TODAY.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> with Voegele performing numerous songs from her album on the show.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.popeater.com/2011/04/13/kate-voegele-one-tree-hill/|title='One Tree Hill' Star and Singer Kate Voegele Dreams of Playing Live in Central Park|work=PopEater|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://thedeadhub.com/2008/02/24/kate-voegele-of-one-tree-hill-interview-part-2/|title=Kate Voegele of One Tree Hill Interview – Part 2 – The Dead Hub|publisher=Thedeadhub.com|access-date=January 15, 2015|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130411222607/http://thedeadhub.com/2008/02/24/kate-voegele-of-one-tree-hill-interview-part-2/|archive-date=April 11, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref> The first episode of One Tree Hill featuring Voegele premiered on January 22, 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bittenandbound.com/2008/01/23/kate-voegele-lands-one-tree-hill-gig-photos/|title=Kate Voegele Lands 'One Tree Hill' Gig (Video, Photos)|work=Bitten & Bound|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/id/22476114/site/todayshow/ns/today-entertainment/t/fresh-faces-hope-make-splash/|title=10 fresh faces hope to make splash in 2008|work=TODAY.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref>{{Citation needed |date=May 2021}}

The same day that Voegele made her appearance on ''One Tree Hill'', her debut album was re-released featuring a new cover art<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Dont-Look-Away-Kate-Voegele/dp/B0011367SO|title=Don't Look Away|website=Amazon|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> and three new acoustic songs.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Dont-Look-Away/dp/B0018DYUOA|title=Don't Look Away|website=Amazon|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> In April 2008, Voegele released her official debut single, "Only Fooling Myself".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/ie/album/only-fooling-myself-single/id277828844|title=iTunes – Music – Only Fooling Myself – Single (Brian Malouf Mix) by Kate Voegele|work=iTunes|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> The song's music video was released in May 2008, and featured Voegele singing as the background changes to various different locations.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/music-video/only-fooling-myself/id279865661|title=iTunes – Music Videos – Only Fooling Myself by Kate Voegele|work=iTunes|date=January 2008|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> The single peaked a #37 on the [[Adult Top 40|Hot Adult Top 40 Tracks]] chart in the US,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/kate-voegele-mn0000383526/awards|title=Kate Voegele – Awards – AllMusic|author=Marisa Brown|work=AllMusic|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://newmusicreviews.net/usa-songwriting-competition-winner-kate-voegele-hits-top-10-on-billboard-200-albums-chart/ |title=USA Songwriting Competition Winner Kate Voegele Hits Top 10 on Billboard 200 Albums Chart | New Music Reviews, Music News, Music Videos, Lyrics and much more! |website=newmusicreviews.net |access-date=2 February 2022 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130413204536/http://newmusicreviews.net/usa-songwriting-competition-winner-kate-voegele-hits-top-10-on-billboard-200-albums-chart/ |archive-date=13 April 2013 |url-status=dead}}</ref> which is based on radio airplay.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.l2pnet.com/kate_Voegele|title=USA Winner Hits Top 10|publisher=L2pnet.com|access-date=January 15, 2015|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090703054118/http://www.l2pnet.com/kate_Voegele|archive-date=July 3, 2009|df=mdy-all}}</ref> In September of the same year, Voegele released her second official single, a cover of the [[Leonard Cohen]] song "[[Hallelujah (Leonard Cohen song)|Hallelujah]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/hallelujah-single/id291076129|title=iTunes – Music – Hallelujah – Single by Kate Voegele|work=iTunes|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> Voegele's version of the song became her first single to chart on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] chart in the US, where it debuted and peaked at number 68 on the chart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://idolator.com/392992/new-kids-on-the-block-have-a-brand-new-hit|title=New Kids on the Block Have A Brand-New Hit - Music News, Reviews, and Gossip on Idolator.com|work=Music News, Reviews, and Gossip on Idolator.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hiphop-elements.com/article/read/4/25330/1/|title=Lil Wayne's 'Lollipop' Returns To Hot 100 Peak - HipHop-Elements.com|publisher=Hiphop-elements.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/305553/kate+voegele/chart|title=Kate Voegele : Chart History : Billboard Hot 100|publisher=Billboard.com|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> This made it the first time any version of the song had charted on the Hot 100,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.atheistexile.com/2012/06/28/hallelujah/|title=Welcome atheistexile.com - BlueHost.com|publisher=Atheistexile.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> and remained the only time the song had made the chart until [[Justin Timberlake]] and [[Matt Morris (musician)|Matt Morris]] released their version in 2010.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/959569/chart-beat-thursday-hope-helps-haiti|title=Chart Beat Thursday: 'Hope' Helps Haiti|magazine=Billboard|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> The success of the singles also helped boost sales of ''Don't Look Away''. The album eventually climbed the ''Billboard'' 200 to achieve a peak of 27, making it her second highest charting album to date.<ref name="billboard.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/305553/kate+voegele/chart?f=305|title=Kate Voegele : Chart History : Billboard 200|publisher=Billboard.com|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/dont-look-away-mw0000573066/awards|title=Don't Look Away – Kate Voegele – Awards – AllMusic|work=AllMusic|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> ''Don't Look Away'' has sold an estimated 237,000 copies as of 2009.<ref name="books.google.com">{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=x1cCZGCbYDwC&q=Kate+Voegele+Don%27t+Look+Away+copies+sold&pg=PA60|title=Billboard|date=May 9, 2009|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref>

The success of Voegele's debut album later led to her appearing on numerous compilation albums that year as well. She recorded a [[cover song|cover]] of the song "[[When You Wish Upon a Star]]" for the compilation album ''[[DisneyMania 6]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B001940N26|title=When You Wish Upon A Star|website=Amazon|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> Her song "It's Only Life" was featured on the soundtrack for the [[ABC Family]] series ''[[Kyle XY]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Kyle-Xy-Various-Artists/dp/B000P7V5W0|title=Kyle Xy Soundtrack|website=Amazon|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> Her song "[[Lift Me Up (Kate Voegele song)|Lift Me Up]]" was later featured on the ''[[AT&T Team USA Soundtrack]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/08/06/AR2008080602916.html|title=Mobile Content Bits: AT& Team USA Soundtrack; MediaFLO NASCAR; T-Mobile 3G; VH1's Scandalist|work=Washingtonpost.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> Voegele's songs "Devil in Me" and "You Can't Break a Broken Heart" are featured on the ''Music from One Tree Hill'' soundtrack, released in 2008.

===2009–2011: ''A Fine Mess'' and ''Gravity Happens''===
It was revealed in 2008 that Voegele would be returning for the sixth season of ''One Tree Hill'' that same year.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/tv-season/one-tree-hill-season-6/id289550242|title=iTunes – TV Shows – One Tree Hill, Season 6|work=iTunes|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> While touring to promote her previous album, she began writing material for her second studio album.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newstimes.com/news/article/Kate-Voegele-pens-A-Fine-Mess-on-the-road-224659.php|title=Kate Voegele pens 'A Fine Mess' on the road|work=NewsTimes|date=May 5, 2009 |access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> While working on her second studio album, Voegele's ''One Tree Hill'' character was also working on her album.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodthewriteway.com/2009/05/kate-voegele-is-fine-mess-on-one-tree.html|title=Hollywood The Write Way: Kate Voegele is A Fine Mess on One Tree Hill|date=May 18, 2009 |publisher=Hollywoodthewriteway.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> Voegele's second studio album, ''[[A Fine Mess (album)|A Fine Mess]]'', was released on May 18, 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/A-Fine-Mess-Kate-Voegele/dp/B0025X4OUW|title=A Fine Mess|website=Amazon|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/a-fine-mess-deluxe-version/id315835789|title=iTunes – Music – A Fine Mess (Deluxe Version) by Kate Voegele|work=iTunes|date=January 2009 |access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0025X4OUW|title=A Fine Mess|website=Amazon|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> The album debuted at number 10 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/a-fine-mess-mw0000815691/awards|title=A Fine Mess – Kate Voegele – Awards – AllMusic|work=AllMusic|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/267176/kate-voegele-taking-a-fine-mess-on-the-road|title=Kate Voegele|magazine=Billboard|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> with first week sales of 37,000 copies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hiphoplead.com/news/eminem-tops-billboards-200-charts-selling-over-600000/|title=Eminem Tops Billboard's 200 Charts, Selling Over 600'000|work=Hip Hop Lead|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/268533/eminems-relapse-tops-billboard-200|title=Eminem|magazine=Billboard|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> This made it the highest first week sales for one of Voegele's albums, and her highest peaking album to date. By September of that same year, the album had sold an estimated 157,000 copies worldwide.{{Citation needed |date=May 2021}} One official single, "[[99 Times]]", was released from the album on April 14, 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.amazon.com/99-Times/dp/B00266144C |title= |website=www.amazon.com |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090707092402/http://www.amazon.com/99-Times/dp/B00266144C |archive-date=July 7, 2009}}</ref> The single went on to become her most successful single in terms of radio airplay, peaking at number 22 on the [[Adult Top 40|Hot Adult Top 40 Tracks]] chart in the US.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newburycomics.com/rel/v2_viewupc.php?storenr=103&upc=60252703680|title=Kate Voegele : A Fine Mess|publisher=Newburycomics.com|access-date=January 15, 2015|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150701194711/https://newburycomics.com/rel/v2_viewupc.php?storenr=103&upc=60252703680|archive-date=July 1, 2015|df=mdy-all}}</ref> This made it her second and highest entry on the chart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/305553/kate+voegele/chart?f=343|title=Kate Voegele : Chart History : Adult Pop Songs|publisher=Billboard.com|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> It also peaked at number 8 on the [[Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles]] chart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/305553/kate+voegele/chart?f=344|title=Kate Voegele : Chart History : Bubbling Under Hot 100|publisher=Billboard.com|access-date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> Voegele returned for the seventh season of ''One Tree Hill'' in 2009, making it the third season to feature Voegele's character.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2009/07/23/ask-ausiello-spoilers-on-greys-csi-and-more/|title=Ask Ausiello: Spoilers on 'Grey's,' 'CSI,' 'Torchwood,' 'Bones,' and more!|work=EW.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvfanatic.com/2009/09/one-tree-hill-photos-clip-from-what-are-you-willing-to-lose/|title=One Tree Hill|work=TV Fanatic|date=September 17, 2009 |access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> Voegele later returned for the eighth season of the series as well, and recorded a version of the show's theme song.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tv.blogs.starnewsonline.com/12805/the-one-tree-hill-theme-song-returns-with-a-twist/|title=The "One Tree Hill" theme song returns – with a twist|publisher=Tv.blogs.starnewsonline.com|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> She continued to play music on the series throughout her appearance.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spoilersguide.com/one-tree-hill/kate-voegele-talks-about-season-8-finale-of-one-tree-hill/|title=Kate Voegele Talks About Season 8 Finale of One Tree Hill|work=Spoilers Guide|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> Voegele did not return for the ninth and final season.

===2012–present: ''Wild Card'' EP and ''Canyonlands''===
Voegele has confirmed that she is working on her fourth studio album, which she hoped to release in 2013;<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/katevoegele/status/308722298981060608|title=katevoegele on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=January 15, 2015}}</ref> while she  released an EP, ''Wild Card'', in 2014, the full album ''Canyonlands'' was released on October 28, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/canyonlands/id1160083566|title=Canyonlands by Kate Voegele on Apple Music|website=[[iTunes]]|date=October 28, 2016 }}</ref>

She released a new single on December 8, 2017—on her thirty-first birthday—titled "Shoot This Arrow".<ref>{{cite web | url=https://itunes.apple.com/album/id1318300584?ls=1&app=itunes | title=Shoot This Arrow - Single by Kate Voegele | website=[[iTunes]] | date=December 8, 2017 }}</ref> The song addresses sexual harassment as well as the sexual harassment allegedly committed by [[Mark Schwahn]], the creator of popular teen drama television series ''[[One Tree Hill (TV series)|One Tree Hill]]''.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://variety.com/2017/music/news/kate-voegele-shoot-this-arrow-sexual-harassment-one-tree-hill-1202633512/ | title='One Tree Hill' Actress Kate Voegele's New Single Supports Those Speaking Out Against Sexual Harassment | date=December 8, 2017 }}</ref>

In 2019, she collaborated with [[Tyler Hilton]] on the song "When the Night Moves", which appeared on his album ''City on Fire''.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.amazon.com/When-the-Night-Moves/dp/B07J63NXFS | title=When the Night Moves | website=Amazon }}</ref>
